content.p: In patients who have AIDS (acquired immune deficiency syndrome), the immune system is compromised by HIV (the human immunodeficiency virus). Many patients die of an infection or from cancer.

question.body: Why are AIDS patients more likely to get cancer?

multiple_choice.choice: The immune system helps clear cancerous cells
HIV induces cancer in the immune system

response.feedback: Correct. With a compromised immune system, cancerous cells cannot be cleared.
Incorrect. Viruses can induce cancer progression, but HIV only inhibits or kills immune cells.
Incorrect. Infections can enhance cancer, but this is not the case here.
Incorrect. HIV usually inhibits or kills immune cells; it does not cause cell division.

part.hint: Remember that AIDS stands for acquired immune deficiency syndrome.
